definition: gesture/sign/signal
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals

sentences.english: Each nationality has its own language of posture and gesture.
sentences.chinese: 每個民族都有自己的身勢語和手勢語。

sentences.english: The point is that it alerts you to something that is being withheld.
sentences.chinese: 重要的是，這個手勢提醒了你事有隱情。

sentences.english: She resembles her mother in the way she moves her hands when she talks.
sentences.chinese: 她說話時打手勢的動作像她媽媽。

sentences.english: But neither girl by word or gesture revealed her blankness.
sentences.chinese: 但是沒有一個姑娘用說話或者手勢來表達她們的惆悵。

sentences.english: Papo furado is typically a gesture made behind the back of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 這個手勢通常要在聊天中的一個主題之後使用。

sentences.english: Hand gestures are commonly known as Mudras in Odissi dancing.
sentences.chinese: 手勢通常被稱爲奧迪西手印在跳舞。

sentences.english: There was a laugh which he cut off brusquely with a gesture.
sentences.chinese: 人們發出一陣鬨笑，他做了個手勢，猛然制止了笑聲。

sentences.english: Gabriel giggled and waved bye-bye back to him.
sentences.chinese: 蓋布瑞爾喫喫的笑著並回以揮手再見的手勢。

sentences.english: He is all flourishes, rococo gestures, and exquisite manners.
sentences.chinese: 他手舞足蹈，優雅地比劃着繁雜的手勢。

sentences.english: Various animation effects initiated by touch, swipes and other gestures.
sentences.chinese: 各種動畫效果開始通過觸摸，揮筆等手勢。

sentences.english: I gestured towards the boathouse, and he looked inside.
sentences.chinese: 我對着船庫比了個手勢，他向裏面看去。

sentences.english: He only uses the hand signal and she converses, Possible she to be able to read his each look.
sentences.chinese: 它只用手勢和她交談，可能她能讀懂他的每一個眼神。

sentences.english: Additionally, support for gestures in Compiz may also be included.
sentences.chinese: 此外，Compiz可能會支持手勢識別。

sentences.english: I answer with prearranged hand signals.
sentences.chinese: 我用事先安排好的手勢作答。

sentences.english: Every gesture of the conductor is subject to a certain level of interpretation.
sentences.chinese: 指揮的每一個手勢都代表了一種演奏法。

sentences.english: We gesture because it’s part of our lexicon.
sentences.chinese: 我們打手勢是因爲它是我們語言的一部分。

definition: both hands
intonation/tone of voice/CL:個|个[ge4]
just now/a moment ago
to provoke/provocation
to aim at/to target/to point at/to be directed at/registration/alignment (mechanical engineering)
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
one side/either side/on the one hand/on the other hand/doing while
legs/both legs/two legs
to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
to overdo it/to overstep the limit/excessively/above one's head/overhead
to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
to turn sth around/to swivel
to give vent to anger
to express thanks
vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
master/qualified worker/respectful form of address for older men/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
